      boolean removePlayer(Player player) 
      int spin(int wheelSize, int initialDelay, int finalDelay, int delayIncrement)
      Spin the gaming wheel progressing from the initialDelay to the finalDelay in increments of delayIncrement delays are in milliseconds (ms) Begin by selecting a random starting number on the wheel (between 1 and wheelSize) Start at initialDelay then increment the delay each time a new number is passed on the wheel Call GameEngineCallback.nextNumber(...) each time a number is passed continue until delay >= finalDelay Call GameEngineCallback.result(...) to finish and process result

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • spin

        public int spin(int wheelSize,
                int initialDelay,
                int finalDelay,
                int delayIncrement)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
        Spin the gaming wheel progressing from the initialDelay to the finalDelay in increments of delayIncrement delays are in milliseconds (ms)
        1. Begin by selecting a random starting number on the wheel (between 1 and wheelSize)
        2. Start at initialDelay then increment the delay each time a new number is passed on the wheel
        3. Call GameEngineCallback.nextNumber(...) each time a number is passed continue until delay >= finalDelay
        4. Call GameEngineCallback.result(...) to finish and process result
        Specified by:
        spin in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        wheelSize - the size of the wheel from 1 .. wheelSize
        initialDelay - the starting delay in ms between numbers when the wheel starts
        finalDelay - the final delay in ms between numbers when the wheel stops (usually 0)
        delayIncrement - how much the wheel slows down after each number is passed
        Returns:
        the final result of the spin (the winning number)

                        int bet)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine

        Specified by:

        number - the lucky number the player picked
        bet - how many points to bet
        Returns:
        true if the bet is placed false if the player does not have enough points
